questions.question: 4. In positive edge triggered D flip flop if D=1 then at negative edge of the clock, the output will be ____

explanations.a: In a positive edge-triggered D flip-flop, the output changes only at the positive edge of the clock
explanations.b: a positive edge-triggered D flip-flop, the output changes only at the positive edge of the clock.
explanations.c: In a positive edge-triggered D flip-flop, when D=1, the input value is stored and reflected at the output only at the positive edge of the clock. At the negative edge of the clock, the flip-flop retains its previous value and does not change
explanations.d: In a positive edge-triggered D flip-flop, the output does not enter a high-impedance state at any point in the operation.
